meanings.definition: A slot or rectangular hole cut into a piece of wood to receive a tenon.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully chiseled the mortises into the wooden frame.
meanings.sent2: The table leg fit perfectly into the mortises on the tabletop.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the mortises of the tree bark.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to have secret stories hidden within its mortises.
meanings.sent5: The ancient door creaked as the key turned in the mortises of the lock.

meanings.definition: To cut a slot or rectangular hole into a piece of wood to receive a tenon.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter mortises the wood to create a strong joint.
meanings.sent2: She carefully mortises the door to install the new lock.
meanings.sent3: The chef mortises the vegetables to create a decorative garnish.
meanings.sent4: The artist mortises the canvas to attach the wooden frame.
meanings.sent5: He mortises the bookshelf to add a hidden compartment.
